subject: remove unnecessary capability-setting logic. This commit requires osp-env-config change also.
commitMessage:
remove unnecessary capability-setting logic.
This commit requires osp-env-config change also.

Change-Id: I95479e64fe53d2e243210f7d44aa8ea9870999ff
Signed-off-by: Young Ik Cho <youngikcho@gmail.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

What value was the capability setting supposed to achieve, and what has changed so that it is no longer necessary? Are the capabilities now required?

Patch Set 1:

CAP_NET_RAW is needed by one privileged network API and native C++ framework assigns all the capabilities and drop capabilities except CAP_NET_RAW after DAC/MAC permission handling.

Intel raised security issue for current logic and after reviewing current architecture, this two-year old legacy code is actually volunable; capability is open to too many unnecessary apps and it takes too much time interval between prctl and the capability drop.

After applying these two patches, apps with the specific network API is not working properly temporary. A system service will assign CAP_NET_RAW capability to apps with the specific privilege dynamically.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We're testing the patches which assign the proper capabilities to the native application dynamically by the Native app service.  Will be added soon. Therefore we can apply this first for the security issues.
